title: Starting Services üöÄ
ques:
You have a `docker-compose.yml` file. You want to start all services defined in it in the background.

Write the command.
explanation: **`docker-compose up -d`** builds, (re)creates, starts, and attaches to containers for a service in detached mode.

title: Compose File Structure üèóÔ∏è
ques: Under which top-level key do you define the containers (like `web`, `db`) in `docker-compose.yml`?
explanation: The **`services`** key contains the configuration for each container in your application.

title: Stopping Services üõë
ques:
You want to stop and remove all containers, networks, and volumes defined in your Compose file.

Write the command.
explanation: **`docker-compose down`** stops running containers and removes them along with networks and volumes created by `up`.

title: Dependencies üîó
ques:
Your `web` service needs the `database` service to be started first. 

Which option in `docker-compose.yml` defines this start order?
explanation: **`depends_on`** expresses dependency between services, causing `docker-compose up` to start services in dependency order.

title: Scaling ‚öñÔ∏è
ques:
You want to run 3 instances of the `worker` service defined in your Compose file.

Write the command to bring up the environment with this scale.
explanation: The **`--scale`** flag allows you to specify the number of containers to start for a service.
